From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To set the terminal screen width, use the **width** command in line configuration mode. To return to the default screen width, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Number of character columns displayed on the terminal. The default is 80 characters.

Examples: In the following example the location for line 7 is defined as "console terminal" and the display is set to 132 columns wide:
ExtraInfo: By default, the route provides a screen display width of 80 characters. You can reset this value for the current session if it does not meet the needs of your terminal.The rlogin protocol uses the value of the *characters* argument to set up terminal parameters on a remote host.

RelatedCmds.description: Sets the number of character columns on the terminal screen for the current session.
